Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "A physiological need creates an internal state of tension (drive) that motivates behavior to reduce that drive and restore homeostasis."
Core Definition: "Focus on 'Homeostasis' and the cycle of biological needs like hunger or thirst."

Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "People are motivated to maintain an optimal level of arousal; seek stimulation when bored and calm when over-aroused (Yerkes-Dodson Law)."
Core Definition: "Look for keywords like 'Optimal level' and 'Yerkes-Dodson' (moderate arousal = best performance)."

Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "Behavior is pulled by external rewards or goals in the environment rather than pushed by internal drives."
Core Definition: "Watch for external 'pulls' like eating dessert for the taste even if full."

Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "Needs are organized in a pyramid; lower-level basic needs (physiological
Core Definition: safety) must be satisfied before higher-level needs (self-actualization) motivate behavior."
CLEP Trap: "Order of stages: Physiological -> Safety -> Belonging -> Esteem -> Self-Actualization."

Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "Stimulus -> Physiological Arousal -> Emotional Experience. Emotions result from our awareness of biological responses."
Core Definition: "Arousal occurs BEFORE emotion ('I feel afraid because my heart is pounding')."

Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "Stimulus -> Physiological Arousal AND Emotional Experience occur independently and at the same time."

Module 1 History and Approaches and Modu: Module 7 Motivation and Emotion
Key Figures: "Stimulus -> Physiological Arousal -> Cognitive Label -> Emotion. To experience emotion
Core Definition: one must be physically aroused and cognitively label the arousal."
CLEP Trap: "Look for 'Cognitive Label' or 'Interpretation' based on context."
